content.prompt:
Listen to the excerpt.


All of the following procedures apply to the cadential six-four chord heard at the end of the excerpt EXCEPT:

choices.label: the fifth of the six-four chord is doubled.
the six-four chord occurs on a strong beat.
the six-four chord occurs on a weak beat.
the six-four chord moves to the dominant chord.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in performed music.
